requirement_assessments.observation: Information security policies documented, approved by management, and communicated to all employees. Policy review cycle is annual. Last review completed December 2025 with 3 policy updates (remote work, AI usage, third-party access).
Information security roles and responsibilities defined in RACI matrix. Security champion program established across 6 engineering teams. Monthly security office hours documented.

Employee background checks performed for new hires in US and UK offices. However, background check process not implemented for contractors in India and Philippines offices (38 contractors). HR confirmed remediation planned for Q2 2026.

User endpoint devices managed via Jamf (macOS) and Intune (Windows). Full disk encryption enforced. EDR agent (CrowdStrike Falcon) deployed on 100% of managed devices. BYOD policy prohibits access to production systems from unmanaged devices.

Configuration management implemented for production servers via Terraform and Ansible. However, 3 legacy database servers are manually configured without infrastructure-as-code coverage. Configuration drift detection not implemented for these servers.

Data encryption at rest implemented for all databases (RDS with KMS), S3 buckets (SSE-S3), and EBS volumes (default encryption enabled). TLS 1.2+ enforced for all data in transit. Certificate management via AWS Certificate Manager with auto-renewal.

Cloud service agreements reviewed but no formal information security requirements included in contracts with 2 of 5 critical SaaS vendors (analytics platform and customer support tool). Legal team acknowledged gap and is drafting updated contract addendums.

Security monitoring covers all production workloads. AWS CloudTrail, GuardDuty, and VPC Flow Logs feed into centralized SIEM (Datadog Security). Alerting rules cover OWASP Top 10 patterns. Mean time to detect (MTTD) is 8 minutes for critical events.
